question: How many nastika philosophies did exist in ancient times, rejecting the authority of the Vedas?
explanation: Nastika philosophies in ancient and medieval India rejected the authority of Vedas, and these philosophies were also known as heterodox or non-orthodox Indian philosophies. There were four major nastika Indian philosophies prevalent in ancient and medieval India which included Buddhism, Jainism, Charvaka, Ajivika.
